comment: Please let this woman retire. I have taken two semesters with her and observed a startling decline in her cognitive abilities. You can tell she's truly passionate about art (sadly rare at this college) but she literally forgets what she's saying every time she speaks now. Wasn't an issue before. Can no longer write coherently. More forgetful.
Just show up! Turn in work on time! Would take her again 100%
Very easy class, wonderful professor.

Her grading is not bad at all. She's super sweet and yes she can be a little clutter but overall the work was not difficult. She'd push you to be better and would hear you out on ideas she's unfamiliar with. Just try your best, she's understanding. Just show up and do the work. Easiest class I've ever taken for a studio course. (Concepts)

generally pretty nice, but as a teacher I can't recommend. She's scatterbrained and doesn't retain who anybody is so it's hard to form any actual connection with her. Allergic to 100%s and gives vague feedback. Also tends to be passive aggressive if she doesn't understand your artwork or you follow up about a grade. Off topic rants and 0 effort pps

Tacks on lots of extra mini-assignments, no prior notice. Runs all courses identically, adding extra work to any subject taught. Unclear about most important aspects of projects. Seems to like lower-effort presentations. Extremely unorganized D2L. Poor writing skills. If she doesn't understand your art you'll get a lower grade.
DO NOT TAKE
I definitely would not take this class again. She gives way too many assignments all at once. I've never been so stressed. She's pretty nice I guess but she kinda does too much..

Very difficult person to work with. She's an ok teacher, but spends most time going through old pps than teaching. Not attending will definitely make you fall behind, and she often assigns things she cant do herself. You need to set aside a lot of time out of class to complete projects. If you complete everything you will get a decent grade though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment:
Her class was not very difficult, but her teaching style was a bit annoying to deal with. She can be a bit scatterbrained and vague with explaining things, on top of her D2L being disorganized. 
I would not take her again, but it was not a completely horrible experience.

Prof. Colebeck is not a great professor for Drawing class. Her time management in class and long-term is poor, like cramming 3 projects in the last 4 weeks of class. She goes on long, unhelpful talks during class and wastes a lot of time. She does know a lot about art but isn't the best at teaching it.

She's a perfectly nice lady for the most part, but her classes are a bit brutal. She gives so much homework.
We're in class for 6 hours straight, and she gives us short breaks, but she gives us at LEAST 3 homework assignments. This wouldn't be a huge problem if we didn't have only one day to complete them. She seems to forget we have other classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Don't listen to the negative reviews, she's great. As an Interactive Design major with no prior drawing experience she was very helpful and gave a lot of feedback, and she judges you fairly based on the work you turn in. As long as you put the effort to improve you'll be ok, she's very funny and always gives you opportunities to improve your grade.

She is very knowledgeable about what she teaches. 9 projects plus a final project where you choose what to do. Don't take if you do not like going on a scavenger hunt through the d2L pages. Useful information/instructions can be difficult to find and she is often not the best at explaining things in class. She is not tech-savvy but tries.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Colebeck is often misunderstood. I took her for both Drawing I and II, and she's a tough, but fair, grader who will point out the flaws in your work. This frustrated me at first, but I learned to appreciate it, as her feedback helped facilitate my growth. You will become a better artist if you put in the time and effort she expects.

I would not recommend this professor to anyone. She would go over three projects at one time and give confusing instructions. Her material did not help me learn. I felt like she was judging my artwork. I hated having to go to her class.

I'm pretty good at drawing, a lot of my friends, other students in the class, and even Mrs. Coleback liked my work. The only reason I got a C is because I never knew when things were due, her online uploads were unorganized, she is old and does not know how to use D2L. Attendance matters, no exceptions. I would skip, too much conflict.

She's a tough teacher, but it's clear she wants you to succeed. Be ready for projects literally every week, some easier than others. Sometimes she grades weirdly. Attendance isn't mandatory, but she will talk crap about you to the other students if you repeatedly miss class. Overall a fun course, and Mrs. Colebeck is really understanding.

If you are someone that cares about your grade, do NOT take her class. Her D2L for the class is a WRECK. Will get mad at students for not turning things in, but will not have a spot for us to submit an assignment. The end of the semester is less than two weeks away and we only have 8 out of 27 assignments graded.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Good person, bad professor. Instructions for assignments are very vague, then she gets frustrated because nobody did the documentation correctly. Doesn't give specific due dates unless asked about it. Oblivious to the fact that we have other responsibilities outside of her class. Expects the IAD students to be just as skilled as the art students.

I can tell that she means well and cares about her students. Unfortunately, she is far too disorganized and scatterbrained to properly give assignments. She contradicts herself constantly (and she knows it) and the majority of classroom activities feel totally pointless. Activities feel like kindergarten assignments.

At first I questioned how she would be, but she does care about your grade. It is very easy work and the work is very interesting. tests are close together in date and she's a little unorganized, but she sends out announcements and reminders. She was a great professor and has a passion for what she does. I'd recommend her to anyone.

She had good intention, long lectures, would draw on your assignments to fix mistakes. She did treat our class drastically different to the same class before us, being more harsh on students+assignments and more disorganized with due dates. The amount of assignments near finals and midterms for HW is like she doesnt respect our outside priorities.

She's a very harsh grader: grades by skill, not effort. If you're not already good at drawing I'd recommend you not take her. There is a lot of homework and big assignments, this class eats up a lot of my time. She's a good teacher and WILL help you improve.

Pretty laidback as far as class structure. Grades fairly and as long as you put in the effort you should pass. Lectures are pretty mediocre but classwork is a bit more interesting. If you are confused about the work she will help you if you put in the time. She sometimes can get off topic a lot when lecturing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Colebeck is a sweet teacher. I can tell she cares for her students. However, she is extremely disorganized. She makes you turn in your work twice. Once for completion and another for a powerpoint portfolio. Gives multiple drawing homework everyday which swamped my class during the COVID semester. Loves her workbook which she teaches from.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Mrs. Colebeck was a great art teacher. She may go off subject every once in a while, but it's a laid back art class. What do you expect? If you are confused on what exactly the project is, ASK HER. Do not set yourself up to failure. Make sure your projects are done for the critiques. All of the projects are easy if you have an ounce of creativity.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: While my class made fun of some of her little quirks, she is an amazing person. She really helped to drastically increase my drawing skills and she gives great feedback on the art. Grading isn't easy but if you try, you can pass and she gives chances to redo the things that pulled your grade down. Great teacher, I would definitely take her again!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Accessible outside class--Gives good feedback

comment: I did not have a good experience in Donna's drawing class. She is scatter brained and loses students' work. She also has quite the negative attitude and never has anything nice to say about people's art. It's really unfortunate that she's the only option on the Marietta campus for drawing. She is no help at all to interactive design students.

She's a great professor who you can tell cares about her students a lot. She's very understanding if you have issues in class or at home and will work with you to make sure you do well. She can be a bit critical especially in her drawing class which is very helpful for improvement but something to be mindful of if you're on the more sensitive side.
She may be scatterbrained, but she is really nice. The progress I made in this class on my art is undeniable. I would definitely take her for another art class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Worst professor I have ever had. I had her for Drawing 2. She never has anything nice to say. If you like your work and she doesn't, too bad. She will literally grab your pencil and draw over what you have been doing instead of giving proper feedback. Stay away at all costs.
Not bad. talks a lot but overall great class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's a sweet lady, but she probably shouldn't be teaching unless she gets a very dedicated teacher's assistant. She is very disorganized, losing track of submitted work and changing project criteria at the last minute. Just today she asked that I write up a previously-unneeded documentation for a project because she "changed her mind." Not great.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Totally disorganized, if you want to learn anything about design or art DONT take this class. She is awful, too scatterbrained and talks too much about nothing. Feels like a elementary art class.

If you have to take this class, be prepared that there's A LOT of work and projects. As long as you come to class, put effort into your assignments and finish them on time, you will get an A. She's a nice professor, but forgetful and scatterbrained at times.

A LOT of work in class and at home even for a 2 day a week near 3 hour class.  Even if youre highly skilled and perfected your project, chances are she will want you to perfect it until its done in her eyes. Her directions are often unclear, so dont be afraid to keep asking if you dont understand something.  Take this class with a LIGHT class load.

My scores are sorta negative but they shouldn't be taken on their own. I definitely left her class a better artist than when I entered. She is very talented and gives good assignments but she will likely burn you out.  I do appreciate her as a teacher but I also found her unnecessarily stressful. Keep track of your work, she is very disorganized.

If you do your assignments, you'll pass. But there's a lot of them. If you're more talented in your area she will give you much harsher critique than those who are just starting out. It is a very tedious class. She is very forgetful and will forget you even turned in your project or lose it. If you want her to remember something, remind her a lot.

A lot of work for her drawing class. ALWAYS show up to class and do the weekly workbook/sketchbook homework assignments. Grades on effort rather than accuracy, but gives helpful techniques on drawing.

She's really ditzy and gives a LOT of homework every week but grades entirely on completion. She's good to take for a class you don't care about as a result of this, but don't take her for a class you're actually looking forward to; she'll make you hate it with the amount of work she gives. Nice and helpful but overall an annoyance of a class.

I have her for two classes. She's great at teaching application for drawing techniques, and even lecturing about art. Very easy to get along with. Sometimes she can be out there, but she's a very nice woman who simply wants you to put in some work, and is willing to meet you halfway if you have an issue.

Well, her class is very easy and I received an A with not even opening either textbook for the class but she assigns a lot of homework/projects and is not clear about due dates or quiz/test dates. She is almost ditzy but if you remind her about what she said about assignments, etc, the class isn't bad. Optional final, 3 allowed absences.

Awesome teacher. I came in wanting to practice and get better and she, and her teaching methods, did help out a ton for my painting classes and skills. A lot of work, but if you didn't want to do art as a profession, I suggest you find another major. Other than that, can't recommend it enough for other art students!

she is a very nice instructor. she gives lots of homework and assignments. she six tests and 10 quizzes. she is easy in grading but after doing all these work, its hard to work on the other classes. her high museum assignment is like 20 hours long assignment. so its better dont take her class.

A LOT of work for her drawing course: several hours' work outside of class, and high expectations for an entry level class, but she grades based on effort and not quality, so no God-given talent required. Also beware: she is a little (a lot) disorganized, and consistently late to class.

she is a nice instructor. she is not organized. her tests are ok. but the problem is she gave us lots of assignments. something was due every week. if u have some other class which you need to put more time pls dont take her class. she will take lots of ur time.

She was a very nice teacher. She gave many instructions, but a word to the wise: She is not technologically savvy. Her website for assignments can be catastrophic and disorganized, often leaving you panicked and confused. They are easy, and the tests were too. Just be sure to ask her about ANYTHING, even assignment-confusion!
A little dingy at times but an overall good experience taking her class
She is pretty good. Knows her subjects and as long you come to class, you'll get an easy A.

She is a real sweet lady. Really caring and willing to help you pass the class as long as you are showing an effort. Her tests are straight forward and simple. she does give a lot of tests and quizzes but they are not difficult. she is really passionate about her work.she is the best.
easy class.  gives you a foundation of understanding art and artworks. just bring yourself your own source of entertainment...trust me you will need.

Very enthusiastic about art, and it comes through.  Show up to class, speak up on occasion, and pay attention when she reviews for the quizzes and tests and you should be fine.  Go to the museums, and be able to tell the difference between types of art that she discusses, and you should get an A.

EASY, Easy, Easy!! Best Art teacher at the school. This class was super easy. Just come to class everyday and take notes. We had 6 tests, we had to remember the different periods of art and match pictures up with them. She will get on you about late work, but after taking her class, I appreciated art more. GREAT CLASS TO TAKE!
If you want to survive this class take your laptop. go to sleep. her directions are scattered. There is a reason why she teaches art. lets be serious colebeck.
She is a very easy teacher and she wants her students to bet A's and B's. Study for test and go to Museums and you should get a A.  I made a 95

Very good professor, one of the best at SPSU. Just do all the projects (they are not difficult) and study about an hour for each exam and you will do fine. Art 2001 is not meant to be a hard class with her. She actually just wants her students to have a better 'appreciation' for the arts.

great class to take to boost your gpa. shes very understanding if youre an architecture student. she lets you make up anything and turn in assignments late. i was going into the final (optional) with a B, but she let me turn in a couple things and take the final and i came out with an A.

Colebeck is a very nice and knowledgeable teacher.  She wants everyone to succeed and works to make sure this happens.  Class is fairly easy if you pay attention.  She does seem scattered, but she will not hold her lack of organization against you.

Really great professor. easy assignments, though sometimes she wont tell you when they are due, so you'll have to follow up on the internet assignment sheets which can be kind of confusing.Had a presentation to present, but like half of the class didn't have to go because she never called us to go. this was good because we still got credit for it.
Easiest class at SPSU by far.  Very helpful and willing to accept late work far after semester is over.  No reason not to get an A.
very very easy, take art appreciation over the other appreciation classes because you WILL get an A. she takes attendance and lets you turn in work late. she's pretty scattered and really nice.

EASY A. The final project is a power point- she'll ask for rough drafts and idea proposals to be turned in before it's due... i turned in nothing but the final but still got a 100 on the project overall. She also allows notecards during the tests. She's ADD, but really nice.
AWESOME prof. I enjoyed her class very much. I would definitely recommend her.

Very nice lady, although she can be somewhat scatterbrained at times.  Will work you, and wants her students to do well.  Dont bother to buy the book.  Very easy A, all you have to do is show up and do the work.

Show up to class and do the assignments.  Most of them require some type of design or questions a fifth grader is capable of. If you like art just a little bit, she'll like you.  A bit spacy you might say, but an easy enough A.

Very helpful if you are late with projects. She works with you. VERY EASY "A", just show up to class. Don't bother to buy the book, she gives you plenty of options to get notes from website. Tests are simple, but she still allows a note card of notes. I actually enjoyed class.

Colebeck is a nice lady. She's kind of crazy but is nice.  If you want an easy A, take her. The content isn't THAT boring so that's a plus. She knows nothing about technology so don't ask her for help about that.
Super easy Guaranteeds A show up to class and do the bs work she gives out dont  buy the bok waste of money

Super Nice professor who does everything in her power to ensure your success.  If you take the class please act like an adult.  She is so lenient that many students revert back to their childish behavior and this can be annoying.

Come to class, guaranteed A. She works to ensure that you get an A. You will have to put up with very boring presentations and her being all over the place. She is very dis-organized but YOU WILL GET AN A. (and that's all that counts)
SUPER EASY! IF YOU WANT AN "A" TAKE THIS CLASS! YOU WONT REGRET IT! SOOOO EASY!

Easy A. Visiting the museums becomes boring, but you can bs your way through class. She takes role everyday, which gets super annoying. just sign your name in for all three days, and skip the other two days. Tests are a joke, she lets you use your notes and books.. but dont waste you're money buying them, cuase you can find everything online! Douch

Easy as crap. Come to class and you automatically pass. Tests-simple. HW-a breeze. Classwork- fingerpainting(literally). The art museum vists are a pain, though. Take her for a easy "A", but be prepaired to put up with her idiocy every class period.  Horrible with technology-its a sad story.
Easy class but with many little stuff to do, just come to class and do whatever required and guarenteed an A.
